授業方法: This class will be held in both face to face on campus and online face to face style. Seminar discussions on research results and case reviews.

第1回:
9/25 Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students, preparing for final presentation Global perspectives and situation analysis on human rights and humanitarian issues:
Conflicts and refugee crises, Human rights abuses and discrimination, SDGs and human rights, where human rights and humanitarian principles meet
第2回: 10/2 (Prof. Miwa) UN and human rights, Universal Declaration of Human Rights, historical development of human rights concept
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on Universal Declaration of Human Rights
第3回: 10/9 (Prof. Miwa) CEDAW and review process, the role of treaty bodies
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on the CEDAW and its review process
第4回: 10/16 (Prof. Miwa) Human Rgiths Council and Universal Periodic Review process
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on UN Human Rights Council’s historical development and Universal Periodic Review’s functions and current issues
第5回: 10/23 (Prof. Miwa) Mainstreaming human rights in UN: Human-rights based approach to programming
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on UN’s Human rights-based approach to programming
第6回:
10/30 (Dr. Sho Akahoshi): Humanitarian Principles: Historical development of humanitarian principles.
Application of humanitarian principles
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on Humanitarian principles
第7回: 11/6 Guest (Prof. Shimizu) UNHCR: Mission and programmes
Each student prepares 1 page report on UNHCR’s programme focus
第8回: 11/13 Guest (Prof. Shimizu) UNHCR: Applying human rights and humanitarian principle for refugee support
Each student prepares 1 page report on challenges in applying HR & Humanitarian principles for refugee support
第9回:
11/20 Coordination within the UN system, and with other humanitarian actors and governments (Inter-agency Standing Committee (IASC)
World Humanitarian Summit
Students will go through the Handbook for RC/HC and become familiar with key processes of humanitarian response
第10回:
11/27 Coordinating humanitarian efforts at the local level: UN country team and other actors:
Humanitarian Coordinator
Using OCHA’s Reliefweb
Assignment: Students prepare one-page report on the roles of the UN Humanitarian Coordinator during humanitarian emergencies
第11回:
12/4 Guest (Ms. Akiko Yoshida)
Head of UN OCHA Kobe
International humanitarian coordination mechanism, tools and services: the roles and activities of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA),
Each student prepares 1 page summary on UN OCHA’s role in global humanitarian architecture.
第12回: 12/11 Guest (Prof. Masanobu Horie): WFP and Humanitarian Assistance, Aid to IDPs in Darfur, Sudan
Each student prepares 1 page summary on WFP’s role in global humanitarian architecture.
第13回: 12/18 Guest (Prof. Masanobu Horie): WFP and Humanitarian Assistance, Case of East and West Timor
Students prepare one page outline of their final presentation with title, research question and reference, due by 12/26
第14回: 1/8 Students' presentation on specific human rights and humanitarian issues and evaluation of the course

1. Pre-assignment: Students prepare final presentations on specific human rights or humanitarian issues, cases, particularly in complex emergencies
2. Submission of their final presentation due by the following day.
